verb.description: Market or charge for (items or services) separately rather than as part of a package.
examples: banks may be forced to unbundle costs and charge extra for each check processed
all systems are now sold unbundled

verb.description: Split (a company or conglomerate) into its constituent businesses, especially before selling them off.
examples: the company's decision to unbundle its retail holdings comes at a bad time
the unbundling practised by leveraged buyout specialists in the 1980s
